Anyone resisting arrest shall be shot, according to the PNP Chief. This order came following the controversial foiled release of a notorious rape-slay convict under the GCTA. As of 19 Sept 2019, at least 2,009 convicts have surrendered. Due to inconsistent data from the Department of Justice and the police, a temporary suspension of operations against convicts has been enforced until a clean list has been submitted by the DOJ.

notes: On 21 Sept 2019, in Barangay Poblacion, Muntinlupa City, Metro Manila, a lawyer and retired police officer was shot dead by unidentified assailants.

As of the morning of 21 September 2019, 2,139 formerly imprisoned convicts had voluntarily surrendered to the Philippine National Police nationwide, exceeding the official count of 'prematurely released prisoners' whom the government had asked to return to prison after previously being freed under the Good Conduct Time Allowance (GCTA) law. The law has proven to be controversial.
A drug suspect was killed during a police raid in San Rafael, Bulacan over the weekend of 21-22 September 2019.

source: Philippine News Agency; Philippine Daily Inquirer
notes: On 22 September 2019, a village chief was shot dead while three others were wounded in an attack by unidentified assailants in Barangay Kayagan, Kabacan, Cotabato.

assoc_actor_1: Students (Philippines)

A drug suspect was killed during a police raid in San Ildefonso, Bulacan over the weekend of 21-22 September 2019.
A drug suspect was killed during a police raid in Lucena, Quezon between 21 to 23 September 2019.
A drug suspect was killed while another was wounded during a police raid at Market 3 of the Navotas Fish Port Complex in Navotas on 22 September 2019.
40 drug suspects were arrested during police operations in Bulacan between 22 to 24 September 2019.
38 drug suspects were arrested during police operations in Quezon province between 21 to 23 September 2019.

On 22 September 2019, two farmers were killed while three survived after being fired upon by the military in Barangay Taopon, Panganiban, Catanduanes. Government officials believe that the military mistook the farmers for communist rebels, while the military said the operation was legitimate and that the fatalities were indeed communist rebels.
A drug suspect was killed during a police raid in Plaridel, Bulacan over the weekend of 21-22 September 2019.
A drug suspect, suspected of committing theft, was killed during a police raid at Barangay Malanday, Marikina on 22 September 2019.
A drug suspect was killed during a police raid in San Ildefonso, Bulacan between 22 to 24 September 2019.
A drug suspect was killed during a police raid in Pulilan, Bulacan between 22 to 24 September 2019.
A drug suspect was killed during a police raid in San Rafael, Bulacan between 22 to 24 September 2019.
A drug suspect was killed during a police raid at Sitio Wella, Barangay 201, Pasay City on 23 September 2019.
A drug suspect was shot dead in a vigilante-style attack by unidentified armed men at Barangay Lagao, General Santos City on 23 September 2019.
A drug suspect was killed during a police raid in Barangay Cotta, Lucena, Quezon on 23 September 2019.

On 23 September 2019, a ranking member of the MNLF and his companion who were bringing explosives were intercepted by military at a routine checkpoint in Barangay Sinawal, General Santos City. A fragmentation grenade and a blasting cap for an improvised explosive device (IED) were retrieved from them.

On 23 September 2019, an NPA rebel was killed following a firefight with government soldiers at Barangay Ongyod, Miagao, Iloilo. A government soldier was also wounded and weapons were retrieved from the rebels.

assoc_actor_2: NUPL: National Union of Peoples' Lawyers; Lawyers (Philippines)
notes: On 23 September 2019, a lawyer belonging to the National Union of Peoples' Lawyers and who was also a mining activist survived an ambush in Timpas, Panitan, Capiz. The lawyer had previously been red-tagged in anonymously-circulated messages, and the NUPL pinned the failed ambush on the military.

On 23 September 2019, the Philippine Secretary of Justice ordered the re-release of more than 300 convicts, who were part of the over-2,000 who had voluntarily surrendered to the Philippine National Police nationwide after being asked to return to prison after previously being freed under the Good Conduct Time Allowance (GCTA) law. The law has proven to be controversial.
A drug suspect was shot dead in a vigilante-style attack by unidentified armed men at along M. J. Cuenco Avenue in Cebu City on 24 September 2019.

On 24 September 2019, three police officers accompanying a village chief were wounded after being attacked by suspected NPA militants on a highway in Socorro, Oriental Mindoro. The NPA later claimed responsibility for the attack, saying instead that there were 12 casualties on the government side.

assoc_actor_1: NUPL: National Union of Peoples' Lawyers; Lawyers (Philippines)
notes: On 24 September 2019, various groups staged a protest in front of the Supreme Court in Manila to demand that a Filipino migrant worker on death row abroad be allowed to testify in a trial in the Philippines through a written deposition. Such a testimony is seen to improve the chances of a favorable ruling in the local trial, which could then help build a stronger case for her freedom. [size=no report]

On 24 September 2019, a police officer on his way to report for duty was gunned down by a suspected NPA rebel along the national highway in Purok 1-Centro Igangon, San Isidro, Davao del Norte. Police officer assumed off-duty.
A robbery suspect was gunned down by police while being transported in a police van to a hospital in Pasay City on 24 September 2019.
A drug suspect was killed during a police raid in Norzagaray, Bulacan on 24 September 2019.
Two drug suspects were killed during a police raid in Barangay San Andres, Cainta, Rizal on 24 September 2019.

On 26 September 2019, a village chief was shot dead by unidentified assailants in Barangay Behia, Tiaong, Quezon.

On 25 September 2019, NPA rebels exchanged gunfire with government soldiers at Barangay Igcabugao, Igbaras, Iloilo. There were no reported casualties on both sides. The military said it retrieved several weapons.

On 25 September 2019, a police intelligence officer on his way home was seriously wounded in an ambush by unidentified assailants in Barangay Kitulaan, Carmen, Cotabato. Police officer assumed to be off-duty.
A drug suspect was killed during a police raid in Norzagaray, Bulacan on 25 September 2019.
A drug suspect was killed during a police raid in Bustos, Bulacan on 24 September 2019.
On 25 September 2019, a village councilor was shot dead by unidentified motorcycle-riding assailants in Barangay Camba, Arayat, Pampanga.
A drug suspect was killed while another was wounded in an encounter with police at a checkpoint in Bualo Lipid, Maimbung, Sulu on 25 September 2019.

A drug suspect was killed then left to burn along with his house in an attack by unidentified armed men, possibly from a rival drug gang, at Barangay Malubog, Cebu City on 25 September 2019. The victim, brother of a slain drug lord, had previously surrendered to the police as a drug personality but had since gone to rehabilitation, though police say he could have returned to his illegal drug business.
On 26 September 2019, the province of Antique established a Provincial Task Force to End Local Communist Armed Conflict (PTF-ELCAC).
On 26 September 2019, various groups demonstrated along Mendiola Avenue in Manila against the use of coal power and the construction of new coal-fired power plants in the country. [size=no report]

On 26 September 2019, a soldier died while his companion was wounded in a 30-minute firefight between the military and NPA rebels in Barangay Aguid, Sagada, Mountain Province. There was an undetermined number of casualties among the rebels.
A drug suspect was killed and another one was wounded during a police raid in Barangay Bualo Lipid, Maimbung, Sulu on 26 September 2019.

assoc_actor_1: Students (Philippines)
notes: On 26 September 2019, students demonstrated at the University of the Philippines in Diliman, Quezon City against the culture of violence and impunity in college fraternities, following an expose on one of such fraternities at the university. [size=no report]
On 26 September 2019, the Naga City Hall security chief was wounded in an attack by unidentified assailants in his home in Barangay San Felipe, Naga, Camarines Sur.

On 27 September 2019, NPA rebels and government soldiers engaged in a 20-minute firefight in Barangay Pinamonoan, Mahaplag, Leyte. No casualties were reported on either side, though the military reported capturing weapons and important documents.

On 27 September 2019, an alleged intelligence officer of the Maute Group was arrested by the police at the Batangas City Public Market. Police also seized half a pound of TNT high explosives, an M67 and a fragmentation hand grenade

On 27 September 2019, an alleged police informer was reportedly killed by suspected armed drug suspects in Navotas. The victim's body was found floating on a canal at Market 3 in Barangay North Bay Boulevard North, Navotas.

On 27 September 2019, about 120 individuals claiming to be former members or supporters of the NPA publicly disavowed the group and burned its flags during their signing of a document called 'Panunumpa sa Pagsalikway sa CPP-NPA-NDF' ('An Oath to Part Ways with the NPA') in Arakan, North Cotabato. The signing of the document and the flag-burning took place in the presence of the military.
On 27 September2019, a Municipal Trial Court employee was shot dead by unidentified assailants in Barangay Binongtoan, Alangalang, Leyte.

On 28 September 2019, a contractor for the National Irrigation Administration (NIA) and his companion were gunned down by unidentified motorcycle-riding assailants in Barangay Canitoan, Cagayan de Oro City.
On 28 September 2019, a former executive of the Presidential Commission for the Urban Poor was shot down by unidentified assailants in Sangandaan, Quezon City.

On 28 September 2019, a village councilor, a village watchman, and another person were gunned down by unidentified assailants in Barangay Takepan, Pikit, Cotabato. The three were drinking with each other when the attack took place.

source: Sunstar (Philippines); Thai News Service; Philippine Daily Inquirer
notes: On 28 September 2019, an NPA rebel leader and another NPA militant were killed in a shootout with government forces at Barangay Lumintao, Quezon, Bukidnon. The military also seized several weapons and other items. The military reported no casualties.
A drug suspect was killed in a police raid in Barangay Banangan, Baguio City on 29 September 2019.

assoc_actor_1: Prisoners (Philippines)
notes: On 29 September 2019, two inmates died during a prison riot that broke out between two rival gangs at the Manila City Jail in Santa Cruz, Manila. 32 others were wounded. [size=no report]

In a surprise gesture celebrated by the media as a hopeful sign of long-term peace in Mindanao, Moro National Liberation Front (MNLF) founding chairman Nur Misuari and Moro Islamic Liberation Front (MILF) Chairman and Bangsamoro Autonomous Region of Muslim Mindanao (BARMM) Interim Chair Murad Ebrahim - famously at odds with each other due to the decades-long dispute between the MNLF and the breakaway MILF - shook hands and embraced during the conclusion of the National Peace Month celebration hosted by the Office of the Presidential Adviser on the Peace Process (OPAPP) in Pasay City on 30 September 2019.

On 30 September 2019, an assailant attempted to carry out a knife attack on a military detachment in Kajatian, Indanan, Sulu, but was killed by the soldiers, among whom one was lightly wounded. The assailant, a university student, had purportedly run after the soldiers and was yelling an Islamic religious phrase. The soldiers said that drugs were later found on him.
